explains: v. 激起，引起；激励，刺激；挑衅，激怒

sentences.en: His duty was to conciliate the people, not to provoke them.
sentences.cn: 他的任务是安抚这些人，而不是激怒他们。

sentences.en: Thinking angry thoughts can provoke strong physiological arousal.
sentences.cn: 想生气的事情能激起强烈的生理兴奋。

sentences.en: Premature moves in this respect might well provoke a reaction against the reform.
sentences.cn: 在这方面过早的行动可能会激起对改革的抵触。
